creator: jayson.johnson@gov.ab.ca
text:
modules/ssl/mod_ssl.mak needs to be fixed to work with the latest OpenSSL 
sources.   Compile options need to be changed from:
/D "NO_IDEA" /D "NO_RC5" /D "NO_MDC2"
to:
/D "OPENSSL_NO_IDEA" /D "OPENSSL_NO_RC5" /D "OPENSSL_NO_MDC2"

support/abs.mak needs to have the same changes made to the compile options.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
This was fixed by introducing both -D NO_IDEA/-D OPENSSL_NO_IDEA style flags,
  but you are welcome to change those flags yourself based on your build of
  openssl.  Unfortunately, Unix loads those into the opensslconf.h declarations,
  but when one builds on Win32, those are not set up properly.
